description:
A sci-fi, summer story filled with suspense set on a small island with Shinpei Aijiro, whose childhood friend Ushio Kofune died. He returns to his hometown for the first time in two years for the funeral. Sou Hishigata, his best friend, suspects something's off with Ushio's death, and that someone can die next.

A sinister omen is heard as an entire family next door suddenly disappears the following day. Furthermore, Mio implicates a "shadow" three days before Ushio's death.

(Source: Disney+)
synonyms: ปริศนาบ้านเก่า เงามรณะ

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Time Loop
tags.description: A character is stuck in a repetitive cycle that they are attempting to break out of. This is distinct from a manipulating time of their own choice.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Clone
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an artificial exact copy of another organism.

node.description: He is a former assistant of the mangaka [Hirohiko Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/97619/Hirohiko-Araki).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B8%A1%E8%BE%BA%E6%AD%A9)

Ayumu Watanabe is a director, screenwriter, storyboard artist and a former animator.

[Twitter](https://x.com/KeigoHoashi)

Keigo Hoashi is a composer and arranger, and a pianist. He was formerly part of the unit [MONACA](https://anilist.co/staff/110481/MONACA).

__[Profile (MONACA)](http://www.monaca.jp/staff/takada.html)__

__Ryuuichi Takada__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and member of music unit MONACA. He mainly composes and arranges for videogames, having worked on the soundtracks for Soul Calibur, Tekken, Katamari Damacy, and The iDOLM@STER.

__[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/okabe)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_okabe)__

__Keiichi Okabe__ is a Japanese vocalist, composer and arranger, who is particularly known for composing soundtracks for game producers Square Enix and Bandai Namco, which include various soundtracks for the Nier, Drakengard, and Tekken series. He is also the founder and CEO of music and sound production studio, MONACA.

[Website](https://monaca.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_jp)

__MONACA__ is a Japanese music production studio, which was established by the composer Keiichi Okabe in October 2004.

__Members__:
• [Keiichi Okabe](https://anilist.co/staff/121585/Keiichi-Okabe) (CEO)
• [Satoru Kousaki](https://anilist.co/staff/101555/Satoru-Kousaki)
• [Ryuuichi Takada](https://anilist.co/staff/109459/Ryuuichi-Takada)
• [Kakeru Ishihama](https://anilist.co/staff/150946/Kakeru-Ishihama)
• [Hidekazu Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/141852/Hidekazu-Tanaka)
• [Keiichi Hirokawa](https://anilist.co/staff/156490/Keiichi-Hirokawa)
• [Kuniyuki Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/154774/Kuniyuki-Takahashi)
• [Shuotarou Seo](https://anilist.co/staff/317330/Shoutarou-Seo)
• [Oliver Good](https://anilist.co/staff/317296)
• [Keita Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/229376/Keita-Inoue)

__Past Members__:
• [Yuri Mitsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/201236/Yuri-Misumi)
• [Keigo Hoashi](https://anilist.co/staff/111233/Keigo-Hoashi)

[Official Site](http://macaroniempitsu.com/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA_UP6PQndF0bE2sUGkCX0g) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/macarock0616) 

__Members:__
- Hattori (はっとり, real name: Ryunosuke Kouno 河野瑠之介) — Vocals, Guitar, Songwriter
- Kenya Takano (高野賢也) — Bass
- Yoshiaki Tanabe (田辺由明) — Guitar
- Daike Hasegawa (長谷川大喜) — Keyboard

__Former Members:__
- Sati (サティ, real name: Masayoshi Sato) — Drums (left September 24, 2017)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cadode_) | [Official Website](https://cadode.jp/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@cadode)

Music unit comprising of [koshi](https://anilist.co/staff/323404/koshi) as the vocalist and lyricist, [eba](https://anilist.co/staff/151944/Eba) as the music producer and [Ryou Tanihara](https://anilist.co/staff/303479/Ryou-Tanihara) as the general manager.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/magicmagico) He joined Okayasu Promotion after graduating and studied there as editor, he collected experience on tv animation and drama and gave his debut on Ninja Hattori. He is currently working for 1000 Yamakoshi. Not to be confused with the other Toshihiko Kojima whose name is written with different Kanji.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chiyomaru5pb)__ | __[Company Profile (MAGES)](http://mages.co.jp/about/company/)__

__Chiyomaru Shikura__ is a Japanese guitarist, novelist, voice actor, radio personality, moderator, animation planner, animation supervisor, music producer, composer, arranger and the representative director of 5pb./MAGES. 

Chiyomaru resigns as chairman and representative director of MAGES. on January 4th, 2023.

He has been the producer and lead animation planner for titles such as Chaos;Head, Steins;Gate, and Robotics;Notes. Shikura is also a very active composer and lyricist. To date, he has written over a hundred theme songs for the video games and anime adaptations he's worked on.
__Hideo Hirata__ is a Japanese producer, music producer and animation planner. He works for record label TOY'S FACTORY.
__Yoshihisa Heishi__ is a Japanese magazine editor, animation planner and producer. He currently works for Shueisha and was an editor-in-chief for Weekly Shounen Jump between 2011-2017.
